org.rdkit.knime.nodes

Class RDKitInteractiveView<T extends NodeModel>

  • java.lang.Object
    • <any>
      • org.rdkit.knime.nodes.RDKitInteractiveView<T>

  • public class RDKitInteractiveView<T extends NodeModel>
extends <any>
    Table view on a org.knime.core.data.DataTable with the capability to show additional information in the header of a column, e.g. a structure based on a Smiles string. It simply uses a JTable to display the data table. If the node has not been executed or is reset, the view will print "<no data>". The view adds also a menu entry to the menu bar where the user can synchronize the selection with a global hilite handler.
    Author:
    Bernd Wiswedel, University of Konstanz, Manuel Schwarze, Novartis

    • Constructor Detail

      • RDKitInteractiveView

        public RDKitInteractiveView(T nodeModel,
                            boolean bIsInputTable,
                            int iIndex)
        Starts a new TableNodeView displaying "<no data>". The content comes up when the super class NodeView calls the modelChanged() method.
        Parameters:
        nodeModel - The underlying model.
        bIsInputTable - Set to true, if the passed in index is from an input table. Set to false, if the passed in index is from an output table.
        iIndex - Index of a port (table).

    • Method Detail

      • createTableContentView

        public TableContentView createTableContentView(TableContentModel contentModel)
        This method is called from the constructor and creates the instance of the table content view. We override here the method TableContentView#getNewColumnHeaderRenderer() to create an instance of derived class of ColumnHeaderRenderer, which is capable of showing additional header information in the column header.
        Parameters:
        contentModel - Table content model retrieved from the node model.
        Returns:
        New instance of a Table Content View.

      • warningChanged

        public void warningChanged(java.lang.String warning)
        Removes all new lines and replaces them by a comma.

      • hasData

        public boolean hasData()
        Checks if there is data to display. That is: The model's content model (keeping the cache and so on) needs to have a DataTable to show. This method returns true when the node was executed and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if there is data to display

      • hasHiLiteHandler

        public boolean hasHiLiteHandler()
        Checks is property handler is set.
        Returns:
        true if property handler set
        See Also:
        TableContentView#hasHiLiteHandler()

        public void setHiLiteHandler(HiLiteHandler hiLiteHdl)
        Sets a new handler for this view.
        Parameters:
        hiLiteHdl - the new handler to set, may be null to disable any brushing

        public void setShowColorInfo(boolean isShowColor)
        Shall row header encode the color information in an icon.
        Parameters:
        isShowColor - true for show icon (and thus the color), false ignore colors
        See Also:

      • updateTitle

        protected void updateTitle()
        Updates the title of the frame. It prints: "Table (#rows[+] x #cols)". It is invoked each time new rows are inserted (user scrolls down).

      • modelChanged

        protected void modelChanged()
        Called from the super class when a property of the node has been changed.
        See Also:
        org.knime.core.node.NodeView#modelChanged()

      • canHandleAdditionalHeaderInformation

        protected boolean canHandleAdditionalHeaderInformation()
        Traverses all columns of the table content model and determines if there is at least one column with additional header information, which can be handled.
        Returns:
        True, if a column was found that has additional header information and can be handled.

      • getInitialAdditionalHeaderInformationHeight

        protected int getInitialAdditionalHeaderInformationHeight()
        Traverses all columns of the table content model and determines the maximum initial height to be used for additional header information. As this is an optional value it will use the column width as height, if no initial height information was found.
        Returns:

      • onClose

        protected void onClose()

      • onOpen

        protected void onOpen()
        Does nothing since view is in sync anyway.
        See Also:
        org.knime.core.node.NodeView#onOpen()
